Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.junit

Class SharedErsatzServerExtension

java.lang.Object
io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.junit.SharedErsatzServerExtension
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterAllCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterEachCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.BeforeAllCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.Extension, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ParameterResolver
public class SharedErsatzServerExtension extends Object implements org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.BeforeAllCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterEachCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterAllCallback, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ParameterResolver
JUnit 5 extension used to provide a simple means of managing an ErsatzServer instance during testing, similar to the ErsatzServerExtension - however, this extension differs in that this extension creates the server instance in the beforeAll method, and destroys it in the afterAll method. The test expectations are cleared in the afterEach method. Configuration of the server instance may be done using a class-level @ApplyServerConfig annotation (not method level), or, if none is provided, the default configuration will be used to create the server. Test methods should add an ErsatzServer typed parameter to the test methods that require access to the server instance. Note: if you need more configuration flexibility, the ErsatzServerExtension allows more, but with the caveat that the server is created and torn down with each test method.
